summary: Accessible public transit in rural and tribal areas can be critical for older adults and people with disabilities. It connects them to jobs, social activities, and essentials like medical care and groceries. The Federal Transit Administration provides grants to these communities to help meet transit needs, such as expanding or establishing new routes and purchasing vehicles. title: Rural and Tribal Transit: The Federal Transit Administration Should Evaluate Its Efforts to Help Improve Accessibility and Service
